summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of an individual (name redacted) conducted on August 19, 2020. The interviewee describes his past relationship with a woman (name redacted) who worked for Jeffrey Epstein as a traveling massage therapist, and details his own role in recruiting girls for Epstein in exchange for cash payments. He also discusses his limited interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Deposed the interviewee approximately five years prior regarding a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a lawsuit for which the interviewee was deposed. The interviewee states she and the woman he dated would go out and get girls together for Epstein, and that she approached him at Mar-a-Lago.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: A rich man in Palm Beach for whom the interviewee's girlfriend worked as a traveling massage therapist. The interviewee describes recruiting girls for Epstein in exchange for $200 cash per girl, and that Epstein would call him.

connections.description: The interviewee states that Maxwell and his girlfriend would 'go out and get girls together for Epstein'.
Epstein paid the interviewee $200 in cash for each girl he recruited and brought to Epstein's residence.
Maxwell allegedly called the interviewee to ask him to pick up specific girls for Epstein, and she approached him at Mar-a-Lago.
The girlfriend worked for Epstein as a traveling massage therapist, traveling with him for two weeks at a time. Epstein paid for her apartment.
The interviewee dated the woman, who was his girlfriend. They lived together in an apartment paid for by Epstein.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The FBI interviews a witness via video conference regarding his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and the recruitment of girls for massages.

events.title: Deposition for Maxwell Lawsuit
events.description: The interviewee was deposed by attorney Brad Edwards for a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Epstein's First Jail Term
events.description: The interviewee recalls speaking with the FBI around the time Jeffrey Epstein first went to jail.

locations: The Island (likely referring to Little St. James)
keyFacts: The interviewee's girlfriend worked for Jeffrey Epstein as a traveling massage therapist, with Epstein paying for her apartment.
The interviewee personally recruited girls for Epstein, driving them to Epstein's residence and receiving $200 in cash for each girl he brought.
The interviewee stated that Ghislaine Maxwell and his girlfriend would 'go out and get girls together for Epstein'.
Epstein instructed the interviewee to make sure the girls he recruited were 18 years old and 'not fat'.

The document references a prior FBI statement (31E-MM-108062 serial #104) where the interviewee claimed Maxwell would call him to pick up specific girls for Epstein, though in this interview he said he didn't recall that detail clearly.
